triplets: Optical equipment consisting of two parallel telescopes mounted side by side for viewing distant objects with both eyes
Bird watching, wildlife observation, sports events, astronomy, navigation, and military or surveillance purposes
Optical glass for lenses and prisms, metal or high-strength plastic for the body, rubber or synthetic coatings for grip and protection
Lenses that focus and magnify distant objects
Eyepieces for viewing through the lenses
Body that houses prisms and lenses
Focus wheel for adjusting clarity and sharpness
Strap for carrying and handling convenience
Typically black, though some models come in camo, green, or other colors depending on use
Outdoor equipment, sports gear, optical instruments, and professional observation tools
Various manufacturers producing recreational, professional, and military-grade binoculars
Approximately 0.5–2 kg depending on size, optics, and model
Approximately 12–20 cm depending on model and magnification
Typically 5–15 years with proper care, cleaning, and storage; higher-end models may last longer
